an4.99:4.1: “Mendicants, these four people are found in the world.
an4.99:4.3: ~One who practices to benefit themselves, but not others; ~one who practices to benefit others, but not themselves; ~one who practices to benefit neither themselves nor others; and ~one who practices to benefit both themselves and others.
an4.99:5.1: And how does a person practice to benefit themselves, but not others?
an4.99:5.2: It’s when a person doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or use alcohol and drugs that cause negligence. But they don’t encourage others to do the same.
an4.99:5.7: That’s how a person practices to benefit themselves, but not others.
an4.99:6.1: And how does a person practice to benefit others, but not themselves?
an4.99:6.2: It’s when a person kills living creatures, steals, commits sexual misconduct, lies, and uses alcohol and drugs that cause negligence. But they encourage others to not do these things.
an4.99:6.7: That’s how a person practices to benefit others, but not themselves.
an4.99:7.1: And how does a person practice to benefit neither themselves nor others?
an4.99:7.2: It’s when a person kills, etc. … and doesn’t encourage others to not do these things.
an4.99:7.3: That’s how a person practices to benefit neither themselves nor others.
an4.99:8.1: And how does a person practice to benefit both themselves and others?
an4.99:8.2: It’s when a person doesn’t kill, etc. … and encourages others to do the same.
an4.99:8.3: That’s how a person practices to benefit both themselves and others.
an4.99:8.4: These are the four people found in the world.”
